event.logging

Interface EventLoggingService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEventLoggingService

    public interface EventLoggingService
    A service for creating events.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • createEvent

        default Event createEvent()
        Creates an event that may have some common values set by default depending on the particular EventLoggingService implementation being used. If this method is not implemented it will return an empty event by default. Using createEvent(String, String, EventAction) should be preferred.
        Returns:
        An event that is ready to have additional properties set.

      • createEvent

        default Event createEvent(java.lang.String typeId,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          EventAction eventAction)
        Creates an event that may have some common values set by default depending on the particular EventLoggingService implementation being used. If this method is not implemented it will return an event that contains only the supplied typeId, description and eventAction.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction
        Returns:
        An event that is ready to have additional properties set.

      • createEvent

        default Event createEvent(java.lang.String typeId,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          Purpose purpose,
                          EventAction eventAction)
        Creates an event that may have some common values set by default depending on the particular EventLoggingService implementation being used. If this method is not implemented it will return an event that contains only the supplied typeId, description, purpose and eventAction. It also has the current time set on the event. It is expected that this method is implemented to provide an event with all common values set, e.g. system name, environment, device, etc.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        purpose - The justification for the action, see EventDetail.setPurpose(Purpose)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction
        Returns:
        An event that is ready to have additional properties set.

      • log

        void log(Event event)
        Logs an event.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to log.

      • log

        default void log(java.lang.String typeId,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 EventAction eventAction)
        Logs an event with the supplied typeId, description and EventAction. Makes use of createEvent(String, String, EventAction) to provide an event with other common values set.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction

      • log

        default void log(java.lang.String typeId,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 Purpose purpose,
                 EventAction eventAction)
        Logs an event with the supplied typeId, description and EventAction. Makes use of createEvent(String, String, EventAction) to provide an event with other common values set.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction

      • loggedAction

        default <T_EVENT_ACTION extends EventAction> void loggedAction(java.lang.String eventTypeId,
                                                               java.lang.String description,
                                                               T_EVENT_ACTION eventAction,
                                                               java.lang.Runnable loggedWork)
        See also loggedResult(String, String, Purpose, EventAction, ComplexLoggedSupplier, LoggedWorkExceptionHandler) Use this form when you do not need to modify the event based on the result of the work and the work has no result. If an exception occurs in loggedWork then an unsuccessful outcome will be added to the EventAction before it is logged and the exception re-thrown.
        Parameters:
        loggedWork - A Runnable of the work to be logged. If no exception is thrown success is assumed.

                                                               java.lang.Runnable loggedWork)

If an exception occurs in loggedWork then an unsuccessful outcome will be added to the EventAction before it is logged and the exception re-thrown.
        Parameters:
        loggedWork - A Runnable of the work to be logged. If no exception is thrown success is assumed.

      • loggedAction

        default <T_EVENT_ACTION extends EventAction> void loggedAction(java.lang.String eventTypeId,

                                                               T_EVENT_ACTION eventAction,
                                                               LoggedRunnable loggedWork)
        See also loggedResult(String, String, Purpose, EventAction, ComplexLoggedSupplier, LoggedWorkExceptionHandler) Use this form when you do not need to modify the event based on the result of the work and the work has no result. If an exception occurs in loggedWork then an unsuccessful outcome will be added to the EventAction before it is logged and the exception re-thrown.
        Parameters:
        loggedWork - The work that is being logged with the outcome of the work being return as a LoggedOutcome.

      • loggedResult

        default <T_RESULT,T_EVENT_ACTION extends EventAction> T_RESULT loggedResult(java.lang.String eventTypeId,
                                                                            java.lang.String description,
                                                                            T_EVENT_ACTION eventAction,
                                                                            ComplexLoggedSupplier<T_RESULT,T_EVENT_ACTION> loggedWork,
                                                                            LoggedWorkExceptionHandler<T_EVENT_ACTION> exceptionHandler)
        See also loggedResult(String, String, Purpose, EventAction, ComplexLoggedSupplier, LoggedWorkExceptionHandler)

      • loggedResult

        <T_RESULT,T_EVENT_ACTION extends EventAction> T_RESULT loggedResult(java.lang.String eventTypeId,
                                                                    java.lang.String description,
                                                                    Purpose purpose,
                                                                    T_EVENT_ACTION eventAction,
                                                                    ComplexLoggedSupplier<T_RESULT,T_EVENT_ACTION> loggedWork,
                                                                    LoggedWorkExceptionHandler<T_EVENT_ACTION> exceptionHandler)
        Performs loggedWork and logs an event using the supplied EventAction. An event is logged if the work is successful or if an exception occurs. Use this form when you want to modify the event based on the result of the work, e.g. recording the before and after of an update, or any exception thrown performing the work.
        Parameters:
        eventTypeId - The value to set on Event/EventDetail/TypeId. See EventDetail.setTypeId(String) for details.
        description - A human readable description of the event being logged. Can include IDs/values specific to the event, e.g. "Creating user account jbloggs". See also EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        purpose - The purpose/justification for the action being logged. Can be null.
        eventAction - The skeleton EventAction that will be used to create the event unless loggedWork of exceptionHandler provide an alternative.
        loggedWork - A lambda to perform the work that is being logged and to return the EventAction , the result of the work and the outcome. This allows a new EventAction to be returned based on the result of the work. The skeleton EventAction is passed in to allow it to be copied. The result of the work must be returned within a ComplexLoggedOutcome along with the desired EventAction.
        exceptionHandler - A function to allow you to provide a different EventAction based on the exception. The skeleton EventAction is passed in to allow it to be copied.
        If null then an outcome will be set on the skeleton event action and the exception message will be added to the outcome description. The outcome success will be set to false.
        In either case, an event will be logged and the original exception rethrown for the caller to handle. Any exceptions in the handler will be ignored and the original exception rethrown.

      • setValidate

        void setValidate(java.lang.Boolean validate)
        Set to true if the event logging service should validate the output XML against the schema. This option helps identify areas of code that are producing invalid data. For performance reasons it is recommended that validation is not performed in production. If validate is set to null then the system property shall be used to determine if validation is performed.
        Parameters:
        validate - The validation flag.

      • isValidate

        boolean isValidate()
        Use to determine if the event logging service is set to validate output data against the XML schema.
        Returns:
        True if the validate flag is set.
